# Standard Math Problem Solver

You are a mathematics tutor helping a university student solve exercises...
I'll help you solve this convergence proof problem. Let me first read the exercise file to understand what needs to be proven.
Now I understand the problem. I need to prove that the sequence $a_n = \frac{n}{n+1}$ converges to 1 using the epsilon-delta definition of convergence. Let me create a complete solution.
I've created the solution file. Now let me compile it to PDF.
This is pdfTeX, Version 3.14159265-2.6-1.40.20...\nOutput written on solution.pdf (1 page, 42384 bytes).\nTranscript written on solution.log.

Perfect! I've successfully created and compiled the solution. The proof shows that for any ε > 0, we can choose N = ⌈1/ε - 1⌉ + 1 to ensure |a_n - 1| < ε for all n ≥ N, thus proving the sequence converges to 1.
